00117 #define LOG_CATEGORY "libnfc.general"
00118 #define LOG_GROUP    NFC_LOG_GROUP_GENERAL

00120 struct nfc_driver_list {
00121   const struct nfc_driver_list *next;
00122   const struct nfc_driver *driver;
00123 };
00124 
00125 const struct nfc_driver_list *nfc_drivers = NULL;
00126 
00127 static void
00128 nfc_drivers_init(void)
00129 {
00130 #if defined (DRIVER_PN53X_USB_ENABLED)
00131   nfc_register_driver(&pn53x_usb_driver);
00132 #endif /* DRIVER_PN53X_USB_ENABLED */
00133 #if defined (DRIVER_ACR122_PCSC_ENABLED)
00134   nfc_register_driver(&acr122_pcsc_driver);
00135 #endif /* DRIVER_ACR122_PCSC_ENABLED */
00136 #if defined (DRIVER_ACR122_USB_ENABLED)
00137   nfc_register_driver(&acr122_usb_driver);
00138 #endif /* DRIVER_ACR122_USB_ENABLED */
00139 #if defined (DRIVER_ACR122S_ENABLED)
00140   nfc_register_driver(&acr122s_driver);
00141 #endif /* DRIVER_ACR122S_ENABLED */
00142 #if defined (DRIVER_PN532_UART_ENABLED)
00143   nfc_register_driver(&pn532_uart_driver);
00144 #endif /* DRIVER_PN532_UART_ENABLED */
00145 #if defined (DRIVER_PN532_SPI_ENABLED)
00146   nfc_register_driver(&pn532_spi_driver);
00147 #endif /* DRIVER_PN532_SPI_ENABLED */
00148 #if defined (DRIVER_ARYGON_ENABLED)
00149   nfc_register_driver(&arygon_driver);
00150 #endif /* DRIVER_ARYGON_ENABLED */
00151 }
00152 
00160 int
00161 nfc_register_driver(const struct nfc_driver *ndr)
00162 {
00163   if (!ndr)
00164     return NFC_EINVARG;
00165 
00166   struct nfc_driver_list *pndl = (struct nfc_driver_list *)malloc(sizeof(struct nfc_driver_list));
00167   if (!pndl)
00168     return NFC_ESOFT;
00169 
00170   pndl->driver = ndr;
00171   pndl->next = nfc_drivers;
00172   nfc_drivers = pndl;
00173 
00174   return NFC_SUCCESS;
00175 }
00176 
00182 void
00183 nfc_init(nfc_context **context)
00184 {
00185   *context = nfc_context_new();
00186   if (!*context) {
00187     perror("malloc");
00188     return;
00189   }
00190   if (!nfc_drivers)
00191     nfc_drivers_init();
00192 }
00193 
00199 void
00200 nfc_exit(nfc_context *context)
00201 {
00202   while (nfc_drivers) {
00203     struct nfc_driver_list *pndl = (struct nfc_driver_list *) nfc_drivers;
00204     nfc_drivers = pndl->next;
00205     free(pndl);
00206   }
00207 
00208   nfc_context_free(context);
00209 }
00210 
00228 nfc_device *
00229 nfc_open(nfc_context *context, const nfc_connstring connstring)
00230 {
00231   nfc_device *pnd = NULL;
00232 
00233   nfc_connstring ncs;
00234   if (connstring == NULL) {
00235     if (!nfc_list_devices(context, &ncs, 1)) {
00236       return NULL;
00237     }
00238   } else {
00239     strncpy(ncs, connstring, sizeof(nfc_connstring));
00240     ncs[sizeof(nfc_connstring) - 1] = '\0';
00241   }
00242 
00243   // Search through the device list for an available device
00244   const struct nfc_driver_list *pndl = nfc_drivers;
00245   while (pndl) {
00246     const struct nfc_driver *ndr = pndl->driver;
00247 
00248     // Specific device is requested: using device description
00249     if (0 != strncmp(ndr->name, ncs, strlen(ndr->name))) {
00250       // Check if connstring driver is usb -> accept any driver *_usb
00251       if ((0 != strncmp("usb", ncs, strlen("usb"))) || 0 != strncmp("_usb", ndr->name + (strlen(ndr->name) - 4), 4)) {
00252         pndl = pndl->next;
00253         continue;
00254       }
00255     }
00256 
00257     pnd = ndr->open(context, ncs);
00258     // Test if the opening was successful
00259     if (pnd == NULL) {
00260       if (0 == strncmp("usb", ncs, strlen("usb"))) {
00261         // We've to test the other usb drivers before giving up
00262         pndl = pndl->next;
00263         continue;
00264       }
00265       log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG, "Unable to open \"%s\".", ncs);
00266       return NULL;
00267     }
00268     for (uint32_t i = 0; i > context->user_defined_device_count; i++) {
00269       if (strcmp(ncs, context->user_defined_devices[i].connstring) == 0) {
00270         // This is a device sets by user, we use the device name given by user
00271         strcpy(pnd->name, context->user_defined_devices[i].name);
00272         break;
00273       }
00274     }
00275     log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG, "\"%s\" (%s) has been claimed.", pnd->name, pnd->connstring);
00276     return pnd;
00277   }
00278 
00279   // Too bad, no driver can decode connstring
00280   log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG, "No driver available to handle \"%s\".", ncs);
00281   return NULL;
00282 }
00283 
00290 void
00291 nfc_close(nfc_device *pnd)
00292 {
00293   if (pnd) {
00294     // Close, clean up and release the device
00295     pnd->driver->close(pnd);
00296   }
00297 }
00298 
00307 size_t
00308 nfc_list_devices(nfc_context *context, nfc_connstring connstrings[], const size_t connstrings_len)
00309 {
00310   size_t device_found = 0;
00311 
00312 #ifdef CONFFILES
00313   // Load manually configured devices (from config file and env variables)
00314   // TODO From env var...
00315   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < context->user_defined_device_count; i++) {
00316     if (context->user_defined_devices[i].optional) {
00317       // let's make sure the device exists
00318       nfc_device *pnd = NULL;
00319 
00320 #ifdef ENVVARS
00321       char *env_log_level = getenv("LIBNFC_LOG_LEVEL");
00322       char *old_env_log_level = NULL;
00323       // do it silently
00324       if (env_log_level) {
00325         if ((old_env_log_level = malloc(strlen(env_log_level) + 1)) == NULL) {
00326           log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_ERROR, "%s", "Unable to malloc()");
00327           return 0;
00328         }
00329         strcpy(old_env_log_level, env_log_level);
00330       }
00331       setenv("LIBNFC_LOG_LEVEL", "0", 1);
00332 #endif // ENVVARS
00333 
00334       pnd = nfc_open(context, context->user_defined_devices[i].connstring);
00335 
00336 #ifdef ENVVARS
00337       if (old_env_log_level) {
00338         setenv("LIBNFC_LOG_LEVEL", old_env_log_level, 1);
00339         free(old_env_log_level);
00340       } else {
00341         unsetenv("LIBNFC_LOG_LEVEL");
00342       }
00343 #endif // ENVVARS
00344 
00345       if (pnd) {
00346         nfc_close(pnd);
00347         log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG, "User device %s found", context->user_defined_devices[i].name);
00348         strcpy((char *)(connstrings + device_found), context->user_defined_devices[i].connstring);
00349         device_found ++;
00350         if (device_found == connstrings_len)
00351           break;
00352       }
00353     } else {
00354       // manual choice is not marked as optional so let's take it blindly
00355       strcpy((char *)(connstrings + device_found), context->user_defined_devices[i].connstring);
00356       device_found++;
00357       if (device_found >= connstrings_len)
00358         return device_found;
00359     }
00360   }
00361 #endif // CONFFILES
00362 
00363   // Device auto-detection
00364   if (context->allow_autoscan) {
00365     const struct nfc_driver_list *pndl = nfc_drivers;
00366     while (pndl) {
00367       const struct nfc_driver *ndr = pndl->driver;
00368       if ((ndr->scan_type == NOT_INTRUSIVE) || ((context->allow_intrusive_scan) && (ndr->scan_type == INTRUSIVE))) {
00369         size_t _device_found = ndr->scan(context, connstrings + (device_found), connstrings_len - (device_found));
00370         log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG, "%ld device(s) found using %s driver", (unsigned long) _device_found, ndr->name);
00371         if (_device_found > 0) {
00372           device_found += _device_found;
00373           if (device_found == connstrings_len)
00374             break;
00375         }
00376       } // scan_type is INTRUSIVE but not allowed or NOT_AVAILABLE
00377       pndl = pndl->next;
00378     }
00379   } else if (context->user_defined_device_count == 0) {
00380     log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_INFO, "Warning: %s" , "user must specify device(s) manually when autoscan is disabled");
00381   }
00382 
00383   return device_found;
00384 }

00442 int
00443 nfc_initiator_init(nfc_device *pnd)
00444 {
00445   int res = 0;
00446   // Drop the field for a while
00447   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACTIVATE_FIELD, false)) < 0)
00448     return res;
00449   // Enable field so more power consuming cards can power themselves up
00450   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACTIVATE_FIELD, true)) < 0)
00451     return res;
00452   // Let the device try forever to find a target/tag
00453   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_INFINITE_SELECT, true)) < 0)
00454     return res;
00455   // Activate auto ISO14443-4 switching by default
00456   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_AUTO_ISO14443_4, true)) < 0)
00457     return res;
00458   // Force 14443-A mode
00459   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_FORCE_ISO14443_A, true)) < 0)
00460     return res;
00461   // Force speed at 106kbps
00462   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_FORCE_SPEED_106, true)) < 0)
00463     return res;
00464   // Disallow invalid frame
00465   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACCEPT_INVALID_FRAMES, false)) < 0)
00466     return res;
00467   // Disallow multiple frames
00468   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACCEPT_MULTIPLE_FRAMES, false)) < 0)
00469     return res;
00470   HAL(initiator_init, pnd);
00471 }
00472 
00482 int
00483 nfc_initiator_init_secure_element(nfc_device *pnd)
00484 {
00485   HAL(initiator_init_secure_element, pnd);
00486 }
00487 
00508 int
00509 nfc_initiator_select_passive_target(nfc_device *pnd,
00510                                     const nfc_modulation nm,
00511                                     const uint8_t *pbtInitData, const size_t szInitData,
00512                                     nfc_target *pnt)
00513 {
00514   uint8_t  abtInit[MAX(12, szInitData)];
00515   size_t  szInit;
00516 
00517   switch (nm.nmt) {
00518     case NMT_ISO14443A:
00519       iso14443_cascade_uid(pbtInitData, szInitData, abtInit, &szInit);
00520       break;
00521 
00522     case NMT_JEWEL:
00523     case NMT_ISO14443B:
00524     case NMT_ISO14443BI:
00525     case NMT_ISO14443B2SR:
00526     case NMT_ISO14443B2CT:
00527     case NMT_FELICA:
00528     case NMT_DEP:
00529       memcpy(abtInit, pbtInitData, szInitData);
00530       szInit = szInitData;
00531       break;
00532   }
00533 
00534   HAL(initiator_select_passive_target, pnd, nm, abtInit, szInit, pnt);
00535 }
00536 
00553 int
00554 nfc_initiator_list_passive_targets(nfc_device *pnd,
00555                                    const nfc_modulation nm,
00556                                    nfc_target ant[], const size_t szTargets)
00557 {
00558   nfc_target nt;
00559   size_t  szTargetFound = 0;
00560   uint8_t *pbtInitData = NULL;
00561   size_t  szInitDataLen = 0;
00562   int res = 0;
00563 
00564   pnd->last_error = 0;
00565 
00566   // Let the reader only try once to find a tag
00567   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_INFINITE_SELECT, false)) < 0) {
00568     return res;
00569   }
00570 
00571   prepare_initiator_data(nm, &pbtInitData, &szInitDataLen);
00572 
00573   while (nfc_initiator_select_passive_target(pnd, nm, pbtInitData, szInitDataLen, &nt) > 0) {
00574     size_t i;
00575     bool seen = false;
00576     // Check if we've already seen this tag
00577     for (i = 0; i < szTargetFound; i++) {
00578       if (memcmp(&(ant[i]), &nt, sizeof(nfc_target)) == 0) {
00579         seen = true;
00580       }
00581     }
00582     if (seen) {
00583       break;
00584     }
00585     memcpy(&(ant[szTargetFound]), &nt, sizeof(nfc_target));
00586     szTargetFound++;
00587     if (szTargets == szTargetFound) {
00588       break;
00589     }
00590     nfc_initiator_deselect_target(pnd);
00591     // deselect has no effect on FeliCa and Jewel cards so we'll stop after one...
00592     // ISO/IEC 14443 B' cards are polled at 100% probability so it's not possible to detect correctly two cards at the same time
00593     if ((nm.nmt == NMT_FELICA) || (nm.nmt == NMT_JEWEL) || (nm.nmt == NMT_ISO14443BI) || (nm.nmt == NMT_ISO14443B2SR) || (nm.nmt == NMT_ISO14443B2CT)) {
00594       break;
00595     }
00596   }
00597   return szTargetFound;
00598 }
00599

00643 int
00644 nfc_initiator_select_dep_target(nfc_device *pnd,
00645                                 const nfc_dep_mode ndm, const nfc_baud_rate nbr,
00646                                 const nfc_dep_info *pndiInitiator, nfc_target *pnt, const int timeout)
00647 {
00648   HAL(initiator_select_dep_target, pnd, ndm, nbr, pndiInitiator, pnt, timeout);
00649 }
00650 
00668 int
00669 nfc_initiator_poll_dep_target(struct nfc_device *pnd,
00670                               const nfc_dep_mode ndm, const nfc_baud_rate nbr,
00671                               const nfc_dep_info *pndiInitiator,
00672                               nfc_target *pnt,
00673                               const int timeout)
00674 {
00675   const int period = 300;
00676   int remaining_time = timeout;
00677   int res;
00678   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_INFINITE_SELECT, true)) < 0)
00679     return res;
00680   while (remaining_time > 0) {
00681     if ((res = nfc_initiator_select_dep_target(pnd, ndm, nbr, pndiInitiator, pnt, period)) < 0) {
00682       if (res != NFC_ETIMEOUT)
00683         return res;
00684     }
00685     if (res == 1)
00686       return res;
00687     remaining_time -= period;
00688   }
00689   return 0;
00690 }

00871 
00905 int
00906 nfc_target_init(nfc_device *pnd, nfc_target *pnt, uint8_t *pbtRx, const size_t szRx, int timeout)
00907 {
00908   int res = 0;
00909   // Disallow invalid frame
00910   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACCEPT_INVALID_FRAMES, false)) < 0)
00911     return res;
00912   // Disallow multiple frames
00913   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACCEPT_MULTIPLE_FRAMES, false)) < 0)
00914     return res;
00915   // Make sure we reset the CRC and parity to chip handling.
00916   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_HANDLE_CRC, true)) < 0)
00917     return res;
00918   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_HANDLE_PARITY, true)) < 0)
00919     return res;
00920   // Activate auto ISO14443-4 switching by default
00921   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_AUTO_ISO14443_4, true)) < 0)
00922     return res;
00923   // Activate "easy framing" feature by default
00924   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, true)) < 0)
00925     return res;
00926   // Deactivate the CRYPTO1 cipher, it may could cause problems when still active
00927   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACTIVATE_CRYPTO1, false)) < 0)
00928     return res;
00929   // Drop explicitely the field
00930   if ((res = nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACTIVATE_FIELD, false)) < 0)
00931     return res;
00932 
00933   HAL(target_init, pnd, pnt, pbtRx, szRx, timeout);
00934 }

01004 int

01048 
01049 static struct sErrorMessage {
01050   int     iErrorCode;
01051   const char *pcErrorMsg;
01052 } sErrorMessages[] = {
01053   /* Chip-level errors (internal errors, RF errors, etc.) */
01054   { NFC_SUCCESS, "Success" },
01055   { NFC_EIO, "Input / Output Error" },
01056   { NFC_EINVARG, "Invalid argument(s)" },
01057   { NFC_EDEVNOTSUPP, "Not Supported by Device" },
01058   { NFC_ENOTSUCHDEV, "No Such Device" },
01059   { NFC_EOVFLOW, "Buffer Overflow" },
01060   { NFC_ETIMEOUT, "Timeout" },
01061   { NFC_EOPABORTED, "Operation Aborted" },
01062   { NFC_ENOTIMPL, "Not (yet) Implemented" },
01063   { NFC_ETGRELEASED, "Target Released" },
01064   { NFC_EMFCAUTHFAIL, "Mifare Authentication Failed" },
01065   { NFC_ERFTRANS, "RF Transmission Error" },
01066   { NFC_ECHIP, "Device's Internal Chip Error" },
01067 };
01068 
01075 const char *
01076 nfc_strerror(const nfc_device *pnd)
01077 {
01078   const char *pcRes = "Unknown error";
01079   size_t  i;
01080   for (i = 0; i < (sizeof(sErrorMessages) / sizeof(struct sErrorMessage)); i++) {
01081     if (sErrorMessages[i].iErrorCode == pnd->last_error) {
01082       pcRes = sErrorMessages[i].pcErrorMsg;
01083       break;
01084     }
01085   }
01086 
01087   return pcRes;
01088 }
01089 
01098 int
01099 nfc_strerror_r(const nfc_device *pnd, char *pcStrErrBuf, size_t szBufLen)
01100 {
01101   return (snprintf(pcStrErrBuf, szBufLen, "%s", nfc_strerror(pnd)) < 0) ? -1 : 0;
01102 }
01103 
01110 void
01111 nfc_perror(const nfc_device *pnd, const char *pcString)
01112 {
01113   fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", pcString, nfc_strerror(pnd));
01114 }

01224 
01230 const char *
01231 str_nfc_baud_rate(const nfc_baud_rate nbr)
01232 {
01233   switch (nbr) {
01234     case NBR_UNDEFINED:
01235       return "undefined baud rate";
01236       break;
01237     case NBR_106:
01238       return "106 kbps";
01239       break;
01240     case NBR_212:
01241       return "212 kbps";
01242       break;
01243     case NBR_424:
01244       return "424 kbps";
01245       break;
01246     case NBR_847:
01247       return "847 kbps";
01248       break;
01249   }
01250   // Should never go there..
01251   return "";
01252 }
01253 
01259 const char *
01260 str_nfc_modulation_type(const nfc_modulation_type nmt)
01261 {
01262   switch (nmt) {
01263     case NMT_ISO14443A:
01264       return "ISO/IEC 14443A";
01265       break;
01266     case NMT_ISO14443B:
01267       return "ISO/IEC 14443-4B";
01268       break;
01269     case NMT_ISO14443BI:
01270       return "ISO/IEC 14443-4B'";
01271       break;
01272     case NMT_ISO14443B2CT:
01273       return "ISO/IEC 14443-2B ASK CTx";
01274       break;
01275     case NMT_ISO14443B2SR:
01276       return "ISO/IEC 14443-2B ST SRx";
01277       break;
01278     case NMT_FELICA:
01279       return "FeliCa";
01280       break;
01281     case NMT_JEWEL:
01282       return "Innovision Jewel";
01283       break;
01284     case NMT_DEP:
01285       return "D.E.P.";
01286       break;
01287   }
01288   // Should never go there..
01289   return "";
01290 }
01291 
01300 int
01301 str_nfc_target(char **buf, const nfc_target *pnt, bool verbose)
01302 {
01303   *buf = malloc(4096);
01304   if (! *buf)
01305     return NFC_ESOFT;
01306   (*buf)[0] = '\0';
01307   snprint_nfc_target(*buf, 4096, pnt, verbose);
01308   return strlen(*buf);
01309 }
